question_text: Why is 127.0.0.1 a special address in IPv4?
answer_options: It is reserved for dynamic assignment
It is used for internal loopback testing
It is the first usable address in a subnet
It is reserved for multicast applications
correct_answer: It is used for internal loopback testing
explanation: 127.0.0.1 is a loopback address used to test a deviceâ€™s internal networking stack without sending traffic onto the network.
